sentences.en: A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that people will lose their jobs.
sentences.cn: 医院院长已澄清了员工将失业的谣言。

sentences.en: Graham attempted to quash rumours of growing discontent.
sentences.cn: 格雷厄姆试图平息有关不满情绪日益强烈的流言。

sentences.en: He applied for judicial review to quash the order.
sentences.cn: 他申请司法检查废止该命令.

sentences.en: I was about to learn how to quash hunger.
sentences.cn: 我要面对的就是如何驱走饥饿.

sentences.en: Since I knew Gauleiter Sturtz of Brandenburg quite well , I was able to quash the affair.
sentences.cn: 由于我熟识勃兰登堡大区区长施蒂茨, 才使大事化小,小事化了.

sentences.en: The administration quickly moved to quash talk of Geithner's ouster.
sentences.cn: 当局迅速澄清关于Geithner可能被罢免的言论.

sentences.en: The appeal court quash the care order make by the juvenile court.
sentences.cn: 上诉法院宣布少年法院发出的照看命令无效.

sentences.en: The applicant seek judicial review to quash the bind - over order.
sentences.cn: 申请人请求司法检查以便废除责令某人守法的命令.

sentences.en: The applicant seeks judicial review to quash the order.
sentences.cn: 申请人请示获得司法复审撤消命令.

sentences.en: The applicant sought judicial review to quash the bin - dover order.
sentences.cn: 申请人请求司法审理以便废除责令某人守法的命令.

sentences.en: The applicant sought judicial review to quash the order.
sentences.cn: 申请人寻求司法复审以撤消命令.

sentences.en: The decision was quashed by the House of Lords.
sentences.cn: 这个决议被上议院推翻了。

sentences.en: The government immediately moved to quash the revolt.
sentences.cn: 政府立即采取行动平定叛乱。

sentences.en: The High Court later quashed his conviction for murder.
sentences.cn: 高等法院后来撤销了他犯有谋杀罪的判决。

sentences.en: Troops were displaying an obvious reluctance to get involved in quashing demonstrations.
sentences.cn: 部队明确表示不愿卷入镇压示威活动。

sentences.en: Unlike the most effective available, the new drug doesn't quash appetite.
sentences.cn: 与目前最有效的药物不同, 这种新药不影响正常食欲.

sentences.en: When you encounter a particular strain, your body eventually produces antibodies to it, which remain on hand to quash that virus the next time you’re exposed.
sentences.cn: 当你遇到一种特殊的抗原时，你体内最终就会产生抗体对付它，下次你再感染这种病毒就会马上产生抗体消灭它。

words.tran_cn: 撤销；镇压；宣布无效；捣碎

trans.tran_en: To quash a rebellion or protest means to stop it, often in a violent way

trans.tran_cn: [法]废除，使无效，捣碎，压碎，平息，镇压
trans.tran_en: to say or do something to stop something from continuing
